pr_title: FAI-216: move DMN domain metrics generation inside DecisionModels

timeline.message: FAI-216: move domain metrics generation in MonitoringDecisionModel

timeline.bodyText: Just a side comment: what about MonitoredDecisionModel?
timeline.author: r00ta

replies.bodyText: Good idea! I changed the name 👍
replies.author: kostola

timeline.author: r00ta

replies.bodyText: Well..now we're only using the new one (with org.kie.dmn.api.core.DMNResult parameter) but I kept the previous one because it was quick in case we may need it again in the future. Should I remove it?
replies.author: kostola

replies.bodyText: For me we should remove it 👍
replies.author: r00ta

replies.bodyText: My only concern is about backward compatibility. @danielezonca wdyt?
replies.author: kostola

replies.bodyText: I think it is safe to remove, it is not a public API and the old usages is codegenerated so it should be automatically "migrated" when they user will compile with the new version
replies.author: danielezonca

timeline.bodyText: Just a side comment: what about originalModel or simply model?
timeline.author: r00ta

replies.bodyText: Good idea as well...went with originalModel
replies.author: kostola

timeline.bodyText: In this way you are hiding any possible error (i.e. template changed). What about preserve the optional and then if empty throws an error?
timeline.author: danielezonca

replies.bodyText:
You're right. I originally used ifPresentOrElse but it's a Java 9+ API and we must stick to Java 8 for kogito-runtimes.
I changed now anyway to throw an exception if the template is changed. 👍
replies.author: kostola

timeline.bodyText: Is this working with/without strongly typed extension?
timeline.author: danielezonca

replies.bodyText: I tested by manually enabling kogito.decisions.stronglytyped=true in kogito-examples/dmn-drools-quarkus-metrics and everything works as expected. Wdyt?
replies.author: kostola

timeline.bodyText: Please check with Sonar cloud. We should probably check if the value is not null before using it.
timeline.author: jiripetrlik

replies.bodyText: I looked more at if. It seems we are in fact checking it. But probably it would be better to check it in a better way to avoid Sonar cloud warning.
replies.author: jiripetrlik

replies.bodyText: I made a change. Let's see if SonarCloud is happy 😉
replies.author: kostola

timeline.message: FAI-216: try to make SonarCloud happy
FAI-216: try to make SonarCloud happy
FAI-216: try to make SonarCloud happy

timeline.author: kostola

timeline.author: kostola
kostola

timeline.bodyText: You probably want to remove the commented block entirely?
timeline.author: manstis
